newsitem.title: UK: UK car registrations rise, post best-ever October.
newsitem.headline: UK car registrations rise, post best-ever October.

text.p: New car registrations in Britain jumped to 154,733 cars in October, up 13.3 percent compared with the year-ago period, the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT) said on Wednesday.
The SMMT said the result was the highest October total on record, and that private sales, during the month of the high-profile UK Motor Show, had been especially strong.

"Particularly encouraging was a rise in private retail registrations of 21.02 percent (in October). This compared with a fleet and business sector rise of just 7.48 percent," the car retailers group said in a statement.
So far this year the trade has reported two contrary trends, with private registrations generally soft and the fleet market generally strong, which have kept overall sales fairly flat.
Including today's data, the cumulative registrations for the 10 months of the year so far show an increase on last year of 4.7 percent, at just over 1.81 million.
